# Queenstown Insights & Recommendations

Welcome to Queenstown! This guide provides local insights and recommendations to help you make the most of your stay in the adventure capital of New Zealand.

## Groceries & Shopping

### Premium Food Shopping
* **McKibbon's of Royalburn**: Premium gourmet grocer offering high-quality local and international products. A collaboration between the Ettema family and Royalburn Station owners Nadia Lim and Carlos Spencer.

* **Neat Meat**: Premium butchery offering high-quality, ethically sourced meats from around New Zealand. Known for exceptional service and product knowledge.

* **Harbour Fish**: Standout seafood supplier bringing the freshest catch directly from Otago waters to Queenstown. Perfect for those special dinner preparations.

* **Fergbutcher**: Premium butchery and gourmet food destination located at 7 Bush Creek Road in Arrowtown. Worth the short drive for exceptional quality.

## Beverages

### Breweries
* **Canyon Brewing**: Local craft brewery with excellent beer selection
* **Altitude Brewing**: Mountain-inspired craft beers
* **Searchlight Brewery**: Creative craft beer experiences

### Wineries

#### Queenstown Area
Multiple world-class wineries within easy reach of the city center

#### Gibbston Valley
Renowned wine region just 20 minutes from Queenstown, famous for Pinot Noir

#### Cromwell & Bannockburn
Central Otago wine region offering cellar doors and tastings

#### Wanaka
Beautiful wine region with stunning lake and mountain views

## Dining

### Cafes

#### In Arrowtown
Historic gold-mining town with charming cafes and excellent coffee culture

#### In Cromwell
Central Otago town with local cafes serving regional produce

### Fine Dining & Restaurants

#### In Queenstown
* Award-winning restaurants with international recognition
* Local New Zealand cuisine featuring Otago ingredients
* Diverse international food scene

#### In Arrowtown
* Historic venues with character and atmosphere
* Local and regional specialties

### Food Delivery
* **DoorDash**: Available for convenient delivery to your accommodation

## Nightlife & Entertainment

### Bars & Lounges
* **Eichardt's Bar**: Premium cocktail experience with lake views
* **The Bunker**: Intimate cocktail lounge
* **Ferg's Bar**: Lively atmosphere and local favorite
* **Little Blackwood**: Craft cocktails and sophisticated atmosphere

## Activities & Adventures

### Adventure Sports
* Bungy jumping (original commercial bungy site)
* Skydiving with spectacular alpine views
* Jet boating on Shotover River
* White water rafting
* Paragliding and hang gliding

### Scenic Experiences
* Milford Sound day trips
* Doubtful Sound overnight cruises
* TSS Earnslaw steamship cruises
* Scenic helicopter flights
* Hot air ballooning

## Hiking & Walking

### Short Walks (1-3 hours)
* Queenstown Hill Time Walk
* Ben Lomond Track (to saddle)
* Lake Hayes circuit
* Arrow River Bridges Trail

### Long Walks (4+ hours)
* Ben Lomond Summit
* Routeburn Track day walks
* Greenstone and Caples Tracks
* Mount Difficulty

### Rainy Day Activities
* Skyline Gondola and Luge
* AJ Hackett Bungy Centre
* Queenstown Arts Centre
* Central Otago wineries
* Indoor climbing at Basecamp
* Shopping at Central Otago and Queenstown malls

## Winter Sports

### Ski Fields & Snow Reports
* **The Remarkables**: Family-friendly skiing with spectacular views
* **Coronet Peak**: Night skiing available, suits all levels
* **Cardrona**: World-class terrain parks
* **Treble Cone**: Advanced skiing with challenging terrain

### Ski/Board Hire
Multiple rental shops throughout Queenstown offering:
* Latest equipment from top brands
* Expert fitting and advice
* Delivery and pickup services available
* Competitive pricing and package deals

## Mountain Biking

### Bike Tracks
* **Skyline Bike Park**: Gravity-fed mountain biking
* **Queen Charlotte Track**: Multi-day riding options
* **Gibbston River Trail**: Scenic valley riding
* **Arrow River Bridges**: Easy family-friendly trail

### Bike Hire
* Full suspension mountain bikes
* E-bikes for easier riding
* Road bikes for sealed surfaces
* Family bikes and child seats
* Guided tour options available

## Local Information

### News Sources
* **Otago Daily Times**: Regional news coverage
* **Queenstown Life**: Local lifestyle magazine
* **The Mirror**: Community news and events

### Local Communities
* Active Facebook groups for locals and visitors
* Community noticeboards in town center
* Visitor Information Centre on Shotover Street

## Practical Tips

### Transportation
* **Bus services**: Connectabus for local routes
* **Taxi and Uber**: Readily available
* **Car rental**: Multiple companies available
* **Airport transfers**: Various options available

### Weather Considerations
* **Summer (Dec-Feb)**: Warm days, cool nights, high UV
* **Winter (Jun-Aug)**: Cold temperatures, possible snow, perfect for skiing
* **Shoulder seasons**: Variable weather, layer clothing recommended

### Booking Tips
* **Peak season**: Book restaurants and activities well in advance
* **Shoulder seasons**: Better availability and pricing
* **Weather dependent**: Have backup plans for outdoor activities

## Emergency Services
* **Police, Fire, Ambulance**: 111
* **Queenstown Police**: 03 441 1600
* **Lakes District Hospital**: 03 441 0015

Enjoy your stay in Queenstown - the adventure capital awaits!

body.raw:
# Queenstown Hill Local Guide

Welcome to Queenstown Hill! This elevated neighborhood offers stunning panoramic views and easy access to both nature and the town center.

## Getting Around

### Transportation Options
- **Rental Car**: Highly recommended for this location
- **Bus Service**: Route 1 connects to town center (every 30 minutes)
- **Uber/Taxi**: $15-20 to Queenstown Central
- **Walking**: 25-30 minutes downhill to town center

### Parking
- Most properties have dedicated parking
- Street parking available but limited
- Town parking: Wilson Parking or council parks

## Nearby Attractions

### Within Walking Distance
- **Queenstown Hill Walkway** (5-10 minutes): Famous scenic walk with 360 views
- **Local Dairy** (10 minutes): Basic supplies and snacks
- **Ben Lomond Track Access** (15 minutes): Advanced hiking trail

### Short Drive (5-15 minutes)
- **Skyline Gondola & Luge**: 8 minutes to base terminal
- **Queenstown Central**: 6 minutes to town center
- **Lake Wakatipu Foreshore**: 8 minutes to lakefront
- **Frankton Shopping**: 10 minutes for supermarkets

## Dining & Entertainment

### Recommended Restaurants (Town Center)
- **Rata**: Fine dining by Josh Emett
- **Fishbone**: Fresh seafood
- **Fergburger**: World-famous burgers (expect queues!)
- **Botswana Butchery**: Premium steaks with lake views

### Casual Options
- **Devil Burger**: Great burgers, shorter queues than Fergburger
- **Yak Yeti Yak**: Nepalese cuisine
- **Taco Medic**: Fresh Mexican food
- **Bespoke Kitchen**: All-day breakfast

## Shopping

### Supermarkets
- **New World Frankton**: 10 minutes drive, largest selection
- **Four Square Central**: In town, smaller but convenient
- **Countdown Frankton**: Budget option, 12 minutes drive

### Specialty Stores
- **Central Otago Wineries**: Local wine tastings
- **Patagonia Chocolates**: Local artisan chocolates
- **Queenstown Mall**: Souvenir and outdoor gear shops

## Activities & Adventure

### Adventure Sports
- **AJ Hackett Bungy**: Original bungy jump site
- **Shotover Jet**: High-speed boat rides
- **Skydive**: Tandem skydiving over the region
- **Wine Tours**: Central Otago vineyard tours

### Outdoor Activities
- **Milford Sound Day Trips**: Scenic fjord tours
- **Lake Cruises**: TSS Earnslaw steamship
- **Hiking**: Ben Lomond, Routeburn Track day walks
- **Mountain Biking**: Skyline bike park

## Practical Information

### Medical Services
- **Lakes District Hospital**: 325 Frankton Road (15 minutes)
- **After Hours Medical**: Frankton Road
- **Pharmacy**: Multiple locations in town center

### Banking
- **ATMs**: Available throughout town center
- **Banks**: ANZ, BNZ, ASB, Westpac all in central area

### Weather Tips
- **Summer (Dec-Feb)**: Hot days, cool evenings, high UV
- **Winter (Jun-Aug)**: Cold, possible snow, heating essential
- **Shoulder Seasons**: Variable weather, layer clothing
- **Rain**: Can be sudden, always carry a jacket

## Local Etiquette

### Respect for Nature
- Stay on marked tracks
- Pack out all rubbish
- Don't feed wildlife
- Respect private property

### Community Considerations
- Quiet neighborhoods - respect noise restrictions
- Limited parking - don't block driveways
- Tourist town - locals appreciate courtesy
- Book restaurants in advance during peak season

## Emergency Services

- **Emergency**: 111 (Police, Fire, Ambulance)
- **Police Station**: Camp Street, Queenstown
- **Fire Station**: Isle Street, Queenstown
- **Search & Rescue**: Coordinated through police

**Need More Info?** Your property manager can provide additional local recommendations tailored to your interests!

body.raw:
# Critical & Essential Information

## Emergency Information

### Emergency Contacts
- **Emergency Services**: 111
- **Property Manager**: +64 21 555 0123
- **After-hours Support**: +64 21 555 0456

### Important Addresses
- **Property Address**: 45 Queenstown Hill Road, Queenstown 9300
- **Nearest Hospital**: Lakes District Hospital, 325 Frankton Road (15-min drive)

## Safety Information

### Safety Equipment
- **Smoke alarms** throughout property (test button monthly)
- **Fire extinguisher** in kitchen
- **First aid kit** in bathroom cabinet

### Fire Safety
- Know your exit routes
- Assembly point: Front driveway
- Never leave fireplace unattended
- Report smoke alarm beeping immediately

### Hot Tub Safety
- Maximum 4 people
- No diving or jumping
- Supervise children at all times
- Exit immediately if feeling unwell

## Transportation

### Getting Around
- **Rental car recommended** for this location
- **Uber/taxi**: $15-20 to town center
- **Bus service**: Route 1, every 30 minutes
- **Walking to town**: 25 minutes downhill

### Parking
- Use only designated parking spaces
- Do not block neighbor driveways
- Street parking available for overflow

## Local Area

### Walking Distance (5-15 minutes)
- **Queenstown Hill Walkway**: 5 minutes
- **Local dairy/convenience store**: 10 minutes
- **Bus stop to town**: 12 minutes

### Nearby Attractions
- **Skyline Gondola**: 8-minute drive
- **Queenstown Central**: 6-minute drive
- **Frankton Shopping**: 10-minute drive

## Weather Considerations

### Winter Safety
- Roads can be icy - drive carefully
- Heating is included - don't hesitate to use it
- Hot tub may be closed for maintenance

### Summer Precautions
- UV levels high - use sunscreen
- Fire risk elevated - be cautious with BBQ
- Popular area - book restaurants in advance

## Important Notes

**Need anything?** We're here to help make your mountain retreat perfect!

**24/7 Support**: For any urgent issues, call our after-hours number.

**Non-urgent Questions**: Text or email the property manager during business hours.

body.raw:
# Mountain Retreat

Your cozy hillside escape with stunning panoramic views of Queenstown and Lake Wakatipu.

## Quick Info
- **Capacity**: 4 guests
- **Location**: Queenstown Hill
- **Check-in**: 3:00 PM
- **Check-out**: 10:00 AM

body.raw:
# User Instructions

## WiFi Access
- **Network**: MountainGuest
- **Password**: Alpine2024!

## Check-in Information

### Key Collection
Your access code will be sent via SMS 2 hours before check-in:
- **Smart Lock**: Front door keypad
- **Backup Key**: Lockbox by garage (emergency only)

### Parking
- **2 dedicated spaces** in the driveway
- **Street parking** available for additional vehicles

## Property Features

### Indoor Amenities
- Full kitchen with modern appliances
- Wood-burning fireplace
- High-speed WiFi throughout
- 55" Smart TV with Netflix
- Washer/dryer in utility room
- Central heating

### Outdoor Spaces
- **Private deck** with mountain views
- **BBQ area** with gas grill
- **Hot tub** (available seasonally)
- **Garden seating** area

## Using the Amenities

### Fireplace Instructions
1. Open flue before lighting
2. Use only provided firewood
3. Ensure fire is completely extinguished before leaving
4. Close flue when finished

### Hot Tub (Seasonal)
- Available with advance notice
- Hours: 8:00 AM - 9:00 PM only
- Maximum 4 people
- Shower before use

### Kitchen Appliances
- **Dishwasher**: Pods provided under sink
- **Coffee Machine**: Nespresso pods in cupboard
- **BBQ**: Gas bottle located beside grill

## Check-out Process

- **Departure time**: 10:00 AM sharp
- **Key return**: Leave keys on kitchen counter
- **Rubbish**: Place bins on street for Tuesday collection
- **Dishes**: Please wash or load dishwasher
- **Climate**: Turn heating to 16C before leaving

## Seasonal Notes

### Winter (June-August)
- **Heating**: Central heating included in stay
- **Hot tub**: May be closed for maintenance
- **Road conditions**: Can be icy - drive carefully

### Summer (December-February)
- **Deck**: Perfect for outdoor dining
- **Hot tub**: Available with advance notice
- **Garden**: Beautiful for morning coffee

body.raw:
# Welcome to Mountain Retreat

Your cozy hillside escape with stunning panoramic views of Queenstown and Lake Wakatipu.

We're delighted to host you at this special property! This guide contains everything you need for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

## House Rules

Please help us maintain this beautiful property for all guests:

- **No smoking** anywhere on the property
- **No parties or events** - this is a residential area
- **Quiet hours**: 9:00 PM - 8:00 AM (respect neighbors)
- **Maximum occupancy**: 4 guests strictly enforced
- **Hot tub hours**: 8:00 AM - 9:00 PM only
- **Pets**: Not permitted

## Respect for Neighbors

This property is in a residential neighborhood. Please:
- Keep noise levels considerate at all times
- Use outdoor spaces respectfully
- Park only in designated spaces
- Follow all local regulations

## Damage & Cleaning

- Report any damages immediately
- Basic cleaning is appreciated but not required
- Additional cleaning fees may apply for excessive mess
- Security deposit covers any damages

**Violation of house rules may result in immediate termination of stay without refund.**

body.raw:
# Critical Information

## Emergencies

### Emergency Services
* **For an emergency requiring ambulance, fire, or police:** Call **111** from any public, private or mobile phone in New Zealand.

### Non-Emergency Contacts
* **Queenstown Police**: 11 Camp Street, Queenstown - 03 441 1600
* **Lakes District Hospital**: 20 Douglas Street, Frankton - 03 441 0015
* **Queenstown Medical Centre**: 9 Isle Street, Queenstown - 03 441 0500
* **Queenstown Dental Centre**: 7 Shotover Street, Cnr Shotover & Stanley Streets, Queenstown - 0800 586 466
* **Wilkinson's Unichem Pharmacy**: Corner Store, Rees Street & The Mall, Queenstown - 03 442 7313

## Health & Safety

### Safety Equipment Locations
This home is equipped with certified smoke detectors, CO2 detectors, a first aid kit and fire extinguishers for use in an emergency.

**Equipment Locations:**
* **First Aid Kit**: Located in the kitchen pantry LHS upper shelf
* **Fire Extinguisher**: Located underneath kitchen sink
* **Gas Shutoff Valve**: To shut off gas main supply area is located RHS of the entrance stairwell, garage side
* **Emergency Exit**: In the event of an emergency, please exit the home through the front door. The emergency meeting point is outside the garage in the driveway.

## Emergency Procedures - Fire

### Fire Detection
Snowbird is fitted with smoke detectors throughout the house.

### Fire Exits
Please familiarise yourself with your nearest Fire Exit:
* **Top Floor Exit**: at the exterior sliding door located at the bottom of the stairs
* **Entry Floor Exit**: at the front entry or from any of the sliding doors (lounge, bedrooms)
* **Lower Floor Exit**: from the garage door or the exterior sliding door at the top of the stairs

### Action in Case of Fire

#### If You Discover a Fire:
1. **Remain calm**
2. **Touch your door** - If it's hot, do not open it
3. **Exit via the nearest fire exit**
4. **If there is smoke** - crawl beneath it to the nearest exit
5. **Once outside** - proceed immediately to the assembly area at the bottom of the driveway
6. **Call 111** to alert the fire brigade
7. **Do not re-enter** the building for any reason

#### If You Are Trapped in a Room:
1. **Stay calm**
2. **Fill the bathroom sink with water**
3. **Wet sheets and towels** - use them to seal around the door
4. **Call 111** immediately and tell them your exact location in the house

## Property Hazards

### Important Safety Warnings
Please be aware of these potential hazards on the property:

* **Driveway**: Blind spots when entering/exiting - drive slowly and carefully
* **Garden Areas**: Unfenced drop-off areas require caution, especially with children
* **Weather Conditions**: Stairs and driveway can become icy in winter conditions
* **Hot Surfaces**: BBQ, wood fire, and hot water systems - exercise caution
* **Bathtubs**: Slippery when wet - use grab rails
* **Children**: Constant adult supervision required near all potential danger zones

### Property Access
* **Property Address**: Queenstown Hill (exact address provided upon booking)
* **Emergency Assembly Point**: Bottom of driveway outside garage
* **Nearest Hospital**: Lakes District Hospital, Frankton (15-minute drive)

## Gas Safety

* **Gas Shutoff Location**: RHS of entrance stairwell, garage side
* **If you smell gas**: 
  1. Do not use electrical switches or flames
  2. Ventilate the area immediately
  3. Turn off gas at the main shutoff valve
  4. Call emergency services if necessary
  5. Contact property management immediately

## Weather & Seasonal Safety

### Winter (June-August)
* **Icy Conditions**: Stairs and driveway can be slippery - use handrails
* **Heating**: Report any heating issues immediately
* **Emergency Supplies**: Extra blankets available in linen closets

### All Seasons
* **Severe Weather**: Monitor local weather warnings
* **High Winds**: Secure outdoor furniture and close windows
* **Heavy Rain**: Some outdoor areas may flood - avoid low-lying areas

## Important Contact Information

**Property Emergency Contact**: [Contact details provided via booking platform]
**24/7 Emergency Line**: Available through booking platform
**Local Council**: Queenstown Lakes District Council - 03 441 0499

## Safety Reminders

* Always inform someone of your planned activities and expected return time
* Keep emergency contact numbers readily available
* Familiarize yourself with all exit routes upon arrival
* Report any safety concerns immediately
* Do not attempt to fix or repair anything yourself

**Your safety is our priority. When in doubt, contact us immediately.**

body.raw:
# Snowbird

An architectural award-winning home nestled on Queenstown's hillside in a safe and quiet neighbourhood, surrounded by parklands. Enjoy this peaceful and private location, while being just a short walk to the town centre.

## Quick Info
- **Capacity**: 6 guests
- **Location**: Queenstown Hill
- **Check-in**: 3:00 PM
- **Check-out**: 10:00 AM
- **Style**: Architectural award-winning design

body.raw:
# User Instructions

## Internet / WiFi

The internet WiFi can be accessed by:
* **Network**: SnowbirdQT
* **Password**: Namaste99

## Heating Guide

### Overview
- Snowbird sits in New Zealand's Southern Alps, where temperatures can swing dramatically (from 30C+ to near freezing)
- The house features a heated concrete floor slab that maintains a comfortable preset temperature throughout
- Wall radiators are integrated into this whole-house heating system

### Temperature Management
- The heated floor maintains consistent warmth throughout the home
- Individual room radiators can be adjusted as needed
- System is designed to maintain comfort automatically
- Please notify us of any heating issues immediately

## Kitchen Appliances

### Gas Hobs
- Turn control knobs counter-clockwise to ignite
- Ensure proper flame before use
- Turn clockwise to off position when finished
- Gas shutoff valve located RHS of entrance stairwell, garage side

### Dishwasher
- Dishwasher tablets provided
- Load dishes properly to avoid damage
- Select appropriate cycle
- Ensure door seals properly

### Microwave & Oven
- Standard operation - instructions available in kitchen
- Preset temperatures and times recommended
- Clean after use
- Report any issues immediately

## Audio Visual

### Television & Entertainment
- Smart TV with streaming services available
- Instructions for operation provided near TV
- WiFi password: Namaste99
- Multiple viewing areas throughout home

### Sound System
- Integrated sound system throughout house
- Instructions for operation provided
- Keep volume respectful of neighbours

## Laundry / Drying Room

### Washing Machine
- Laundry powder provided
- Standard wash cycles available
- Clean lint filter after use
- Drying room available for hanging clothes

### Dryer
- Use appropriate settings for fabric type
- Clean lint filter before and after use
- Do not overload

## Children

### Child-Friendly Features
- High chairs available upon request
- Safety gates can be installed if needed
- Childproof latches on appropriate cabinets
- Outdoor areas are secure but require supervision

### Safety Notes
- Adult supervision required at all times
- Balconies and stairs require extra caution
- Hot surfaces and appliances - keep children away
- Pool/spa area requires constant adult supervision

## Miscellaneous

### Electric Blinds
- Automatic operation via wall controls
- Manual override available if needed
- Please close blinds in evening for privacy

### Windows & Ventilation
- All windows have security locks
- Fresh air circulation recommended
- Close windows during rain
- Report any sticking or issues

### Maintenance & Issues
- Report any problems immediately via booking platform
- Emergency contact information in Critical Information section
- Do not attempt repairs yourself
- Document any issues with photos if possible

### General Tips
- Familiarize yourself with all amenities upon arrival
- Instructions available throughout the home
- Contact us with any questions
- Enjoy your stay at this beautiful award-winning home!

body.raw:
# Welcome

## Dear Guest

Thank you for choosing to stay at Snowbird. We trust your stay here will be more than enjoyable. For your convenience we have prepared a Guidebook to assist you during your stay. Should you experience any problems or difficulties with regard to the home during your stay please do not hesitate to contact us via the booking platform. We are here to help!

## The Home & Neighbourhood

Snowbird is an architectural award winning home nestled on Queenstown's hillside in a very safe and quiet neighbourhood, surrounded by parklands. Enjoy this peaceful and private location, while being just a short walk to the town centre. Here you will find lots of adventure, shopping, dining, nightlife, transportation, and more!

# House Rules

## Important

* This home is a short-term rental property and operates in a quiet residential area with consent from the local council. 
* Compliance to the House Rules ensures the home remains compliant to the conditions of the consent from the local council.

## House Items

* Consumable items in the house are provided free of charge on a fair use basis (this includes basic cooking supplies, tea, coffee, laundry powder, dishwasher capsules/powder, soaps & body wash, etc). 
* Unused items remain property of the home.

## Security & Responsibility

* Please help us make your stay an enjoyable and memorable one. Please look after your valuables and secure your accommodation. Despite protective measures we are unable to assume any responsibility and will not be liable for any loss or damage to your possessions in or around the property.
* The hosts/owners are not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illness that occur while on the premises or its facilities, as well as loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guest. This includes adults and children.
* **Note:** The house alarm is not in operation.

## Check-In & Check-Out

| Check-In after | Check-Out before |
| :------------: | :--------------: |
|      3pm       |       10am       |

**Note:** There are multiple parties who rely on these times for cleaning and maintenance. If you need different arrangements, please contact us in advance.

## Occupancy & Guests

* Maximum occupancy is strictly enforced for safety and compliance reasons
* All guests must be registered at booking time
* Visitors and additional guests require prior approval
* No parties or events are permitted

## Noise & Neighbours

* This is a quiet residential neighbourhood
* Please respect neighbours at all times
* Quiet hours are from 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM
* No loud music or excessive noise at any time

## Smoking & Substances

* No smoking anywhere inside or outside the property
* No illegal substances permitted
* Violation will result in immediate termination of stay and forfeiture of deposit

## Cleanliness & Care

* Please treat the home with respect and care
* Clean up after meals and activities
* Report any damages or issues immediately
* Additional cleaning fees may apply for excessive mess

## Compliance

Failure to comply with these house rules may result in:
* Immediate termination of your stay without refund
* Additional charges for damages or excessive cleaning
* Reporting to booking platforms and local authorities if necessary

We want you to have a wonderful stay while respecting our home and neighbourhood!
